channel.title: Minor Questions
channel.description:
I don't normally talk about myself. But I have some questions about WebHosting, etc. And they involve me spending some of my time, cash, patience, etc. And I need to know before I get in to deep if it's the right thing to be doing.
Let me just start by saying that I've been doing Web Design, and I've been a Web Master for a couple years now, and I really have put off getting into this area because I wasn't sure if it was the right way to go. And I've thought about it, and I would really like to go this route. Besides the fact I'll have a 'partner in crime'. But uh, I was wondering about Web Servers, OS's and Gaming Servers.
I am looking too buy two Rack Mount Servers, each with 2 GB of RAM, and a 250 GB Hard Drive. They use an AMD 64 Processor, and I need to know if they can host 2 Counter-Strike Servers, a WoW Private Server, 9 web sites, and probably individual forms for each.
BE BACK LATER TO FINISH TALKING.

item.title: Minor Questions
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“RXVL, post:10, topic:162395”]…
Most likely you’re going to need faster than a 768K connection, probably like a 30Mb/s connection (Optimum Online w/ Boost gets 30 Mb/s down and 5 Mb/s up).[/quote]

I have BellSouth Extreme DSL, I can’t check the abilities it has right now. But I figured I’d just let you all know. Just in case I do have to switch service providers.

Read full topic

item.title: Minor Questions
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:9, topic:162395”][quote author=error.login link=topic=220848.msg1914030#msg1914030 date=1196821785]
…
MEEEE! lol just trying to get some signups but i can make a package just for u?
[/quote]

Umm… It depends, show me your site, and I’ll think about it. Otherwise I’m staying with Nationvoice.[/quote]

Most likely you’re going to need faster than a 768K connection, probably like a 30Mb/s connection (Optimum Online w/ Boost gets 30 Mb/s down and 5 Mb/s up).

Read full topic

item.title: Minor Questions
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“error.login, post:8, topic:162395”]…
MEEEE! lol just trying to get some signups but i can make a package just for u?[/quote]

Umm… It depends, show me your site, and I’ll think about it. Otherwise I’m staying with Nationvoice.

Read full topic

item.title: Minor Questions
item.dc:creator: @error.login cane
item.description:
@error.login wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:5, topic:162395”][quote author=Greeny link=topic=220848.msg1912484#msg1912484 date=1196733747]
That will bring a hefty bill what’s your budget?
[/quote]

I have figured in all the prices, as well as scoped out the things I will need.

[ul][]Rack Mount Server - $649.99 (Qt. 2)
[]Server Rack - $749.99 (Qt. 1)
[]19" SamSung Widescreen LCD - $179.99 (Qt. 1)
[]MicroSoft Business Hardware Pack (Mouse & Keyboard) - $29.99 (Qt. 1)
[*]cPanel 10 - $1499.99 (Qt. 1)[/ul]

That is what I’m going to need to continue to run the site. I’m going to run a site off of a Web Hosting provider, (Probably NationVoice, unless someone here knows a better deal). Which then I will advertise with Google Adsense. Host a clan site, (with around 40 or so members), as well as a Computer Gaming Appreciation site. So I can get a good user base, and earn the cash to buy this equipment. I am looking to not have to pay out of my own pocket for the venture, which is why I need to know what other areas I can make profit from besides ads. I’ve worked out a donation system, and a membership fee as well. So I am hoping to make from $170.00 to anywhere in the range of $220.00

“Minor” questions. If these are minor, so is the ancient question, “what is the meaning of life?”

Nice response.

EDIT:

…
Uhhmm… Kind of pushing it with that much stuff split across two of them, however you haven’t told us the CPU speed, but I think the main problem might be your ISP giving you the banhammer because of all the bandwidth you’d be pulling.

You probably would want to ask your ISP if they even allow you to host your own sort of server like that or if you’d have to upgrade to their business package or something.

I have Extreme BellSouth DSL so it’s not that much of a problem, and if it is, I can relocate the servers, or change my Service Provider. I’m not looking at 10,000 users a day or anything. 300 a day tops. Besides, if I need to get another server that isn’t a problem. Initially, I’ll be with NationVoice anyways, so I can scope out how many users I’ll have a day, and whatever else.[/quote]
MEEEE! lol just trying to get some signups but i can make a package just for u?

Read full topic

item.title: Minor Questions
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I don’t need information on running a website. I’ve done that for a long time. It’s the physical hosting I have trouble with. I was looking for donations from the clan, now that will be there, the donations are a later addition, and they won’t be just any kind of donation, they will be a donation in exchange for special privileges.

Read full topic

item.title: Minor Questions
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

just an fyi, people won’t donate unless they really believe in your site/ideas. So don’t count on donations from the clan…

Read full topic

item.title: Minor Questions
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Greeny:

That will bring a hefty bill what’s your budget?

I have figured in all the prices, as well as scoped out the things I will need.

[ul][]Rack Mount Server - $649.99 (Qt. 2)
[]Server Rack - $749.99 (Qt. 1)
[]19" SamSung Widescreen LCD - $179.99 (Qt. 1)
[]MicroSoft Business Hardware Pack (Mouse & Keyboard) - $29.99 (Qt. 1)
[*]cPanel 10 - $1499.99 (Qt. 1)[/ul]

That is what I’m going to need to continue to run the site. I’m going to run a site off of a Web Hosting provider, (Probably NationVoice, unless someone here knows a better deal). Which then I will advertise with Google Adsense. Host a clan site, (with around 40 or so members), as well as a Computer Gaming Appreciation site. So I can get a good user base, and earn the cash to buy this equipment. I am looking to not have to pay out of my own pocket for the venture, which is why I need to know what other areas I can make profit from besides ads. I’ve worked out a donation system, and a membership fee as well. So I am hoping to make from $170.00 to anywhere in the range of $220.00

Silver Lining:

“Minor” questions. If these are minor, so is the ancient question, “what is the meaning of life?”

Nice response.

EDIT:

[quote=“VB7 Rocks, post:4, topic:162395”]…
Uhhmm… Kind of pushing it with that much stuff split across two of them, however you haven’t told us the CPU speed, but I think the main problem might be your ISP giving you the banhammer because of all the bandwidth you’d be pulling.

You probably would want to ask your ISP if they even allow you to host your own sort of server like that or if you’d have to upgrade to their business package or something.[/quote]

I have Extreme BellSouth DSL so it’s not that much of a problem, and if it is, I can relocate the servers, or change my Service Provider. I’m not looking at 10,000 users a day or anything. 300 a day tops. Besides, if I need to get another server that isn’t a problem. Initially, I’ll be with NationVoice anyways, so I can scope out how many users I’ll have a day, and whatever else.

Read full topic

item.title: Minor Questions
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

ThAt0n36Uy:

I am looking too buy two Rack Mount Servers, each with 2 GB of RAM, and a 250 GB Hard Drive. They use an AMD 64 Processor, and I need to know if they can host 2 Counter-Strike Servers, a WoW Private Server, 9 web sites, and probably individual forms for each.

Uhhmm… Kind of pushing it with that much stuff split across two of them, however you haven’t told us the CPU speed, but I think the main problem might be your ISP giving you the banhammer because of all the bandwidth you’d be pulling.

You probably would want to ask your ISP if they even allow you to host your own sort of server like that or if you’d have to upgrade to their business package or something.

Read full topic
